performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Definitely one of the best versions of Brother Esau I've heard. Find the Russ Cansler AUD source. Was also released on DVD as View From The Vault 4.
Tight on point rendition of what could be an off kilter tune -whole show blazes.
By all accounts, this is a rather goofy song, but i love this version.  Entire show is spot on

performances.venue: River Bend Music Center Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Great Brother E with a cool effect on Bobby's voice. Such a great show..
Super tight, awesome version
The best version I have heard yet of this weir'd little ditty. Sbd.
Fiery Esau, shortlived but is beloved by many Bobby fans
Complete with kickin' cow bell, nice long intro, easily one of the best you'll find.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: VERY hit-or-miss song for me but this one HITS HARD
Really relaxed show on Jerry's part, flows wonderfully.
Just the right amount of cowbell. Dave's Picks 39

performances.venue: Marin County Veterans Auditorium San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Nice keys

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Wow, the 1984-07-15 is a close one but this is still my all time favorite.
Funkiest version I've heard

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: This one bounces, spins, and rolls through the waves rather well.
Compact, very well played, whole band is tight.  Bobby nails the vocals.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: cool
What can I say, I love Bobby and i love this tune.  This naturally quirky song is executed perfectly, as with most outings in spring/summer '85
Shadowboxing the apocalypse and wandering the land.

performances.venue: Calveras County Fairgrounds Angels Camp, CA
performances.description: Another Hot run through of the all to rare 80's Bobby classic.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Great Jerry leads excellent Bobby vocals band is really in a groove, one of the Best Esau's I have ever heard.
Really rockin' and just an all around fun vibe. Lot of energy from everyone. whole first set is killer!
Awesome bounce to this version. Just the right raspiness from Bob, and how can Jerry's playing not put a big grin on your face!
A great Deep Elem Blues->My Brother Esau combo!

performances.venue: Indianapolis Sports and Music Center Indianapolis, IN
performances.description: A curious set list.
Very tight, jammed-out version from my favorite '84 show.
billy and mickey sound great here. good bobby and phil too.
Shadowboxin' and wanderin'... great Oade Bros AUD show
One of the few times the band played on my birthday and a good version too.
Right off of a tasty Althea
It's just played really well. The entire show is good but nothing better than an A-. Show was heavy in my rotation in youth. A+ SBD. Nice CRS opener!
Fun, bouncy version

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: A Nice later era version from the Big Apple's Garden. Also Dave's pick for 11/4/23 Dead Show 30 Days of November
I like this one...great groove to it.
This song is not really in a "heady" format, but I always liked it as a 1st set tune. This version is well.played as is this show.

performances.venue: Downs of Santa Fe Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: Sweetness outdoors in Santa Fe.
Set 2 Opener Cool placement.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Jerryz intro is extra sweet on this version and he's on point throughout. A fine pre coma Jerry while Bobby is off at times lyrically. Still Heady!
A nice grovin' version right on the beach.

performances.venue: Park West Ski Resort Park City, UT
performances.description: Heady indeed!
A nice early groovin' version.
A fun version of a dopey song.
Pretty ok Brother Esau

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: cowbell anyone?

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: I don't care what people think.........I always have loved this song!!!!!!!!!!!!
Very rare track even only available on the tape,lol. Nice version from a nice show and a pek mid 80's year.

performances.venue: West Virginia University Coliseum Morgantown, WV
performances.description: Very spacey drifty dreamy version.

performances.venue: Patrick Gymnasium, U of Vermont Burlington, VT
performances.description: Excellent reading of the short lived Bobby tune.
Upbeat version that doesn't skip a beat from start to finish.
They almost never got this song right, so it's no wonder they stopped playing it. This time they did. Bobby doesn't oversing, drummers are on it.
Phil rocks it. I love this tune!

performances.venue: Niagara Falls Convention Center Niagara Falls, NY
performances.description: Nice and mellow reading crisp and clean.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Criminally underplayed Bobby tune, this one has a nice slinky groove
Wow Great
Some fantastic interaction between Garcia and Brent. This song is definitely one of the more underrated ones!

performances.venue: San Francisco Civic Center San Francisco, CA
performances.description: A nice version.

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Standout version with an extended marimba intro that's a dinosaur stomp if I've ever heard one
This version rules.  Feels even super funky. Tons of cowbell.
Nice punchy version, underrated song.
IMHO, Best ever
Sometimes hard to tell one from another. But whatever. This one is good. It's from City Island, which should have been a cool spot to watch a show.
Strong and solid version from the underrated Jerry Comeback Show
They sound angry at this show and in a good way. It really suits the song. Bobby sings it great. I love the downbeat inflection on "in LA."
Brent hits the spot
RIP Bobby!
A classic Esau
Played every night of the 3/29-31 Warfield run, I'd say this is the best of the three. Good vocal and guitar solo, and Brent shines throughout.
Boisterously grasping for the oneness. Hits deep groove with aplomb

performances.venue: Marin County Veterans Auditorium San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Very good version from an underrated show, from an underrated year
A little extra for Farm Aid
putting some muscle into this
Phil kills it here
